result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie J Marlow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during  the term of probation.  
If revoked, DOC to collect at the rate of 25% of prison funds.    Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at zero.
Full time employment or a combination of part time employment and school.

Provide a specimen for DNA testing, if not already done so.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with Geraldo S. and with D.H.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
To commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on February 2, 2016.
Release for employment and school.

records.addlTxt: Signed and Filed:  Decision and Order Denying Request for Good Time Credit
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.
Petition and Order for Funeral Pass
No reply from surety/defendant.

Defendant DOES NOT appear. Tyrone M. St. Junior III appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Surety in Court. Bail arguments made; Court DENIED Surety's request for return of bail.
Bail remains FORFEITED.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 03-04-2016 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Maxine White. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($175.00) gj
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($2500.00 signature bond) gj
Defense counsel submitted letters and papers to the court  as to sentencing.

Defendant Willie J Marlow in court with Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Flora M., and defendant.  

Court finds defendant  IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  48  months with 25 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  24  months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24  months.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3  years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
- Serve 8 months in the House of Correction with release for employment and school.  Condition time to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on February 2, 2016
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Full-time employment or a combination of part-time employment and school
- No Contact Order with Gerardo S.
- No Contact Order with D.H.
- Perform 52 hours of community service at the Greentree Community Center
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Full-time employment or a combination of part-time employment and school
- No Contact Order with Gerardo S.
- No Contact Order with D.H.
- Perform 52 hours of community service at the Greentree Community Center
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing (if not already done so)
If confinement is served  - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant in Court.  He has not been to the public defenders office to determine qualification.  Defendant instructed to proceed immediately to the public defenders office to determine if he qualifies.  Defendant given new date to return with documentation of whether he qualifies or not.

10/15/2015

Defendant may now qualify for public defender representation.  Matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.  Defendant to be produced for this date if he has not bailed out.

Attorney Pecora in Court on another matter.  Attorney Pecora informed of the calendar conflict for the currently scheduled date of 11/11/15 @ 8:30.  New date calendared for 11/9/15 at 1:30 p.m.  Attorney Pecora to notify his client of the new date.

Later same day, ADA Arn contacted the Court indicating the currently scheduled date needs to be rescheduled as he will be at a conference.  Telephone call and voice mail message left for Attorney Pecora to contact the Court to reschedule this matter.

Defendant Willie J Marlow in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie J. Marlow not in court, defendant in custody.  Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Pecora made arrangements to have this matter adjourned to another date prior to this Court date as he was going to be on vacation.  On August 11, 2015, bail was addressed and raised due to a WCS violation.   Defendant was taken into custody.   This matter remained on the calendar so that if the defendant bailed out prior to today's court date, he would appear and obtain the new court date.  Case calendared for Sentencing  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court sets bail at $175.00 cash TOT Justice Point for continued monitoring.  Matter to remain on the calendar for sentencing.

Case is adjourned for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 21.

Defendant Willie J Marlow in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited. Defendant remanded.
  Return on warrant scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Pecora in court this date requesting a new court date as he will be on vacation 8/14/15.  Defendant to appear to receive his new date slip.

Defendant Willie J Marlow in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing hearing, however Branch 21 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation (missed office contact that was then made up) Report received and filed.

Defendant Willie J Marlow in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski for Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 21.
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Count 1 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
